roleset.name: create
roleset.note: MAKING-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00060. Comparison to 'make-n' and 'make.01-v'. VN class build-26.1-1. Framed by Katie. (from making.01-n)
MAKE-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. Comparison to 'make.01'. VN class build-26.1-1. Framed by Katie. (from make.01-n)

roles.note: This usage is extremely rare, if it exists at all. Given that there is now a separate roleset for 'making', all such instances should appear under that lemma. (from make.01-n)

example.name: basic transitive
example.text: Loews Corp makes Kent cigarettes.

example.name: passive, source as of-phrase
example.text: [Those chips]-1 are made *trace*-1 of gallium arsenide.

example.name: mincemeat pie
example.text: But the surprisingly durable seven-year economic expansion has made mincemeat of more than one forecast.
example.arg: the surprisingly durable seven-year economic expansion

example.name: make a deal
example.text: Well , they have made deals with Likud before .

example.name: Arg 1 only
example.text: the making of an engine disk

example.name: arg0 and arg1
example.text: a wooden block of his making

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: the image making of the cosmetic trades

example.name: arg 1
example.text: He plays an active role in policy making.

example.name: verbal small clause
example.text: Mary made John clean his room

example.name: nominal small clause
example.text: Financial problems make them unattractive takeover targets.

example.name: adjectival small clause
example.text: Asian nations' memories make them fearful of Japanese economic hegemony.
example.arg: them fearful of Japanese economic hegemony

example.name: with tough-movement
example.text: SC Law makes it a crime to breach test security.
example.arg: it a crime to breach test security

example.name: cause to be
example.text: For Zel Herring, owner and a cook at the Sandhills Luncheon Cafe, a tin building in midtown, all this has made for a very goodyear.
example.arg: For Zel Herring, owner and a cook at the Sandhills Luncheon Cafe, a tin building in midtown

example.name: make sure
example.text: We will do everything we-1 can *PRO*-1 to make sure that he shows up at his court date there .
example.arg: sure that he shows up at his court date there.

roleset.name: earn cash or wages, earning
roleset.note: MAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on make-v.05. No corresponding VNcls. (from making.03-n)

example.name: make a quick buck
example.text: If Bill Gates made a nickel every time Windows crashed...oh wait, he does.

example.name: job as for-phrase
example.text: Judy Rodin makes way too much money for what she does.

example.name: job as as-phrase
example.text: Judy Rodin makes way too much money as Penn's president.

example.name: All args
example.text: I don't see anything wrong with this speech and his making a living doing what he's doing here or going after the audience he has here in this video.

example.name: take that, eh?
example.text: Americans make better fishermen.
*PRO*-2 Overcome *-1 by hunger pains Sellers-2 would eat massive amounts of food and then throw it up *PRO*-2 to make weight.
Some other stories making headlines right now.
We made the finish line!

roleset.name: "way" construction: make one's way, travel
roleset.note: MAKE-V NOTES: Doesn't fit with any other sense, unavoidable, although it seems inappropriate to have a roleset/sense for a construction that is productive with many verbs: She danced/wiggled/laughed/cheated her way... (from make.19-v)

example.name: All arguments
example.text: Hundreds of Californians made their way to their computers after the quake , and checked in with each other on electronic bulletin boards , which link computers CB-radio-style , via phone lines .

roleset.name: light verb
roleset.note: MAKE-V NOTES: The original light verb frames make.03 and make.04 have been collapsed into this frame. (from make.LV-v). Combines with: decision, comment, cut, choice,determination, distinction, etc.

roleset.name: comprise, build, structure
roleset.note: MAKE_UP-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns, make_up-v.07. Corresponds to VNcls build-26.1. (from make.02-n)

example.name: passivized
example.text: [40% of the homeless population]-1 is made *trace*-1 up of women and children.

example.name: corresponding active
example.text: Women and children make up 40% of the homeless population

example.name: args 0&1
example.text: Scientists have suspected there must be something different about the genetic make - up of diabetics who develop complications ;

example.name: basic transitive
example.text: *trace* Make up your own mind on the issue.

example.name: intransitive, compound subject
example.text: After fighting for a week, John and Mary finally kissed and made up.

example.name: split actors
example.text: John finally made up with Mary.

example.name: transitive
example.text: John made up all the answers on his midterm.

role.descr: entity which is behind in something (eg payments)

example.name: bad student
example.text: John will have to make up the midterm at some later date.

example.name: instrumental agent
example.text: Some Democrats, led by Rep. Jack Brooks (D., Texas), unsuccessfully opposed the measure because they fear that the feesmay not fully make up for the budget cuts.

roles.note: (I haven't actually seen any of these in WSJ, but who knows?) (from make.12-v)

example.name: typical usage?
example.text: I can't make out the handwriting on this letter.

example.name: Imperative
example.text: Please *PRO* make out the check to "AT& T"

example.name: getting by
example.text: At his new job, as partner in charge of federal litigation in the Sacramento office of Orrick, Herrington& Sutcliffe, he will make out much better.
example.arg: At his new job, as partner in charge of federal litigation in the Sacramento office of Orrick, Herrington& Sutcliffe,

roleset.name: describe, make it seem like
roleset.note: MAKE_OUT-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. See VNcls characterize-29.2. Comparison to 'describe'. (from make.23-v)

role.descr: secondary attribute; what arg1 is made to seem like

example.name: All args. Arg2= like
example.text: You make it out like hampering a nation s development is somthing new !
example.arg: like hampering a nation's development is something new

example.name: All args
example.text: But an agressive opposition , along with a biased press and press with an agenda make them out to be a lot worse than they are .
example.arg: an agressive opposition, along with a biased press and press with an agenda
to be a lot worse than they are

example.name: Arg1 as sentential complement
example.text: The University made out [0] it was much better than it seems .
example.arg: [0] it was much better than it seems.

roleset.name: french kiss
roleset.note: MAKE_OUT-V NOTES: Based on Bolt SMS data. Comparison with kiss.01, but minus the arg 2 for secondary predication (*I made out with him goodbye). No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from make.26-v)

example.name: When both participants are in one arg, use arg 0
example.text: We was just making out!

example.name: when the two parties are seperate
example.text: John made out with Mary

example.name: without destination
example.text: The governor couldn't make it, so the lieutenant governor welcomed the special guests.

example.name: with destination
example.text: John-1 couldn't be bothered *trace*-1 to make it to his own funeral.

example.name: if I can make it there, I'll make it anywhere
example.text: Mike Huber, a roustabout, is even making it in his new career as an entrepreneur.
example.arg: in his new career as an entrepreneur

example.name: bank robbers
example.text: When he initially refused, he says, they stabbed him in the back and made off with $2,000 and 280 blank tickets.

roleset.name: rework or revamp, renovate
roleset.note: MAKE_OVER-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. No corresponding VNcls. (from make.03-n)

role.descr: end state, made over into what?

example.name: from a google search
example.text: The following year, Clarence Rowland, then managing the Sox, made him over into an outfielder and farmed him out to the Milwaukee American Association Club.
example.arg: Clarence Rowland, then managing the Sox

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: She professionally and diligently executed her make over of my home through the use of additional furnishings and accessories which she provided.

example.name: Oooh La La!
example.text: August was especially special because of two things: First, Clinton Street would get her make-over of fresh tar and pea gravel in early August (maybe late July).
example.arg: of fresh tar and pea gravel

example.name: another args1 and 2
example.text: The bride to be had a 5 star service and she loved her make-over of sultry orange russet tones to complement her skin tone.
example.arg: of sultry orange russet tones to complement her skin tone

roleset.name: pretend
roleset.note: MAKE_BELIEVE-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. Comparison to pretend.01 (from make.24-v)

example.name: Both args
example.text: You can make believe things are getting better or you can understand that things are getting worse and deal with it .

roleset.name: make do: cause to be sufficient
roleset.note: MAKE_DO-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from make.25-v)

example.name: both args
example.text: When I was at uni , I think I could count the number of students who lived away from home and had a car on one hand - the rest mnade do with a young person s railcard .
example.arg: with a young person s railcard

roleset.name: nominal version of light verb
roleset.note: MAKING-N NOTES: Roleset based on usages in nouns-00060 project. No relevant VN cls. Framed by Claire (from making.02-n)

roles.note: This roleset should only be used for cases where 'making' acts as a light verb and the object of 'making' is also an eventive, predicating noun. Use argMs for all other arguments-- these cannot be predicted because they are related to the true predicate rather than 'making'. (from making.02-n)

role.descr: maker, subject of light verbish noun

example.name: True predicate only - decision making
example.text: The key to the creation of the `` organic '' state lay in the formation of `` natural '' groups that would undertake the role of decision - making .

example.name: With argMs - decision making
example.text: Still , case - by - case retrospective decision making of this sort is vulnerable to the tunnel vision caused by a fixation on ad hoc -LRB- and usually sleazy -RRB- examples .

example.name: With argMs plan-making
example.text: Strategic spatial plan-making is thus a process through which knowledge and value, rules and procedures are actively mobilized.

example.name: True predicate only - offer making
example.text: The basic principle behind offer making is to try to get a better deal.
